intro: Sida carrascoana, commonly known as the Mexican mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in summer. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Sida carrascoana is often found in disturbed areas, such as roadsides and fields.
